Initial scent resembled finger nail polish remover. Pleasant scent couple hours later. Long lasting but forgettable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2145868"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2145868#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2145453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2145453" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marialena888m"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1135263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1135263.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="marialena888m" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Splendida-Magnolia-Sensuel-47820.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47820.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Splendida Magnolia Sensuel"title="Splendida Magnolia Sensuel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2145453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2145453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1135263">marialena888m</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-04">05/04/24 08:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice pink rose scent, natural smelling and balanced, though I would have liked it a little greener and more dewy. It’s lovely enough and it does smell refined, but boring and abit too simplistic on its own. My favorite way to wear it is layered with Feminin Pluriel. Longevity is moderate, so is the sillage. Overpriced for what it is. I actually prefer Dior’s Kabuki Rose or La Colle Noir to A La Rose, Kabuki Rose is more dewy-fresh and abit greener than A La Rose, and La Colle Noir is abit more complex with better sillage and longevity. I purchased A La Rose and Feminin Pluriel together, only because the travel sized sprays (3x11ml) were on sale, they’re great for semi-formal or formal situations when I need something elegant and refined, but ‘safe’, clean, and suitable for our subtropical desert climate…perfect size to carry around for touch-ups. I‘ll save them for that purpose but I won’t repurchase when I run out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2145453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2145453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2145225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2145225" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mrjohn12"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/491405"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.491405.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mrjohn12" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-N05-Eau-Premiere-1360.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1360.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel N°5 Eau Premiere"title="Chanel N°5 Eau Premiere"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2145225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2145225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/491405">mrjohn12</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-04">05/04/24 03:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Starting with my general thoughts on ALR, then moving into comparisons: ALR is the kind of fragrance that can carry you away in its photorealism.  The star of the show, a genuine, dewy, fully bloomed and fragrant sun-warmed pink rose.  It’s supporting characters, a barely there sweet citrus to help you taste the rose and a soft musk to lift it ethereally from your skin.  Yes there are a lot of rose fragrances, but none like this. <br />
<br />
I wear this in warm weather because it’s meant for brightness, but in the dead of winter, it brings that spring brightness to me and lasts all day.  It’s not soapy or clean, but juicy!<br />
<br />
ADR Rosa Novella: soapy, leans white floral<br />
ADR Rose Gardenia: jammy bath product<br />
Initio Atomic Rose: sexy, jammy, red rose<br />
MFK Oud Satin Mood: jammy and powdery<br />
Matiere Radical Rose: more vintage <br />
Diptyque Eau Rose: softer and more musky<br />
Prada Infusion de Rose: soapy and powdery<br />
LDP Rose Trombone: deep soapy fruity</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2145225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2145225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2135311" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2135311" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2135311ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2135311" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-24">04/24/24 15:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nice and simple rose tinted with magnolia. I find it a little too shampoo-like. The magnolia is distracting and takes away from the rose. Not enough of a naturalistic rose for my liking. It’s a nice fragrance on the whole but it’s overpriced for what it is. I seem to love everything FK does for every house except his own.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2135311"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2135311#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130182" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cillie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2086211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2086211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cillie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Rose-Kabuki-48380.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48380.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Kabuki"title="Rose Kabuki"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2086211">cillie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 01:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Scent is very similar to Fresh’s Morning Rose. Rose water / powdery rose scent which I’m not a fan of.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2130182"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2130182#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118273" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2118273" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brainrot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1394823"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1394823.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="brainrot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2118273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2118273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1394823">brainrot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-08">04/08/24 11:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Is it a groundbreaking scent? No. Does it perform better than most perfumes? No. Is it eye wateringly expensive? Yes, but it's a lovely, simple, inoffensive rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2118273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2118273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2110653" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I absolutely love the scent of roses. This smells like a realistic rose and I will be buying a bottle of this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2110653"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2110653#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2087768" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PolarBear2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6864"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.6864.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PolarBear2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Thameen/Carved-Oud-20509.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20509.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carved Oud"title="Carved Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2087768ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2087768" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6864">PolarBear2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-10">03/10/24 00:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this in anticipation of spring during dreary winter weather.  On the paper, it smelled like a nice rose fragrance. But when sprayed on skin, it is the freshest of fresh pink roses, wet with rain, and truly beautiful.   I dont smell powder but just wet fresh pink roses, the kind that greets you in the garden after a drizzle - the fragrance transported me to a bouquet of wet roses - wet wet wet and fresh. One of the exceptional rose fragrances out there. I recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2087768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2087768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2064826" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2064826" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lykopa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492443"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1492443.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lykopa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Acqua-di-Parma-Blu-Mediterraneo-Fico-di-Amalfi-1687.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1687.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"title="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2064826ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2064826" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492443">Lykopa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-17">02/17/24 00:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I could write a love letter to this fragrance, I would. It’s soft and floral and feminine. Almost a little salty in the best possible way there’s a nice splash of citrus, and it reminds me of a bright spring day. The perfect rose for when you want to feel like a girl.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2064826"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2064826#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2062072" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2062072" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheCandyperfumegirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193100"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193100.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheCandyperfumegirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Miller-Harris/Myrica-Muse-76345.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76345.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrica Muse"title="Myrica Muse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2062072ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2062072" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193100">TheCandyperfumegirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-14">02/14/24 10:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>À La Rose opens with beautiful rose Scent with combination of Citrusy notes of Bergamot and Orange which gives this Perfume a freshness and hints of Violets to give it a powdery vibe too.<br />
According to their official website "À la rose is an ode to femininity, a declaration of love translated into a fragrance. Two hundred and fifty freshly bloomed roses from Grasse offer their unequalled richness to every bottle." <br />
And this Perfume is really a beautiful rose Scent which is dewy, fresh, vibrant and sweet. It's not a powdery overpowering rose or cheap rose water type Fragrance . This one smells like real fresh, sweet, juicy, dewy rose and smells expensive. It's like a fresh bouquet of pink roses with hints of Powdery violets,cedar and musk. Cedar and Musk is really noticeable on the Drydown but two types of roses are the centre of this Perfume. <br />
🌹 This Perfume is really uplifting and mesmerising. This is a clean inoffensive scent. And it's suitable for all kinds of formal or informal occasions. It's kind of romantic, innocent, gentle and comforting ❤️<br />
🌹If you love the smell of rose but you can't tolerate too much Strong perfume this Fragrance is for you. It's not overpowering or cloying so those who get migraine headaches from strong fragrances can use this Perfume without facing any problems.<br />
🌹 Longevity- On my skin I get around 6+ hours and on clothes I get around 7+ hours of longevity. Performs better in warmer but less humid days from my experience. Apply a little on your hair(with a good hair serum) to get better performance and longevity. <br />
🌹 Sillage &amp; Projection- It's a close to skin scent. For the first 1-2 hours people within your hands distance will be able to smell this Perfume but after that gradually it will become a skin Scent and only when someone hugs you theywill be able to smell the perfume on you. It's good for close encounters. Apply a little on your scarves during hot summer days and you'll leave a soft trail of scent everywhere you go. <br />
🌹 Overall it's a nice soft, romantic and elegant Scent. It's easy to love this fragrance ❤️ <br />
<br />
💟I have a sentimental connection with this Fragrance as it was one of my wedding Scents. I wore this on the day of our Walima (wedding reception) and my Husband loves this Perfume too ❤️ So it's really close to my heart 😊 It's inspired by Marie Antoinette’s love of roses. She was the last Queen of France before the French Revolution. Maison Francis Kurkdjian named the perfume after a famous portrait of Marie Antoinette A La Rose painted by Louise Elisabeth Vigée-Lebrun.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2062072"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2062072#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2057597" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2057597" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="layyelisee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440375"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1440375.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="layyelisee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Oud-Satin-Mood-30352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Satin Mood"title="Oud Satin Mood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2057597ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2057597" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440375">layyelisee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-09">02/09/24 16:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>She is the prettiest floral fragrance. <br />
The best word I can use to describe this fragrance is “pretty”. She’s such a lovely, simple fragrance that smells like a pretty lady. I’ve never cared for floral fragrances and have always leaned towards gourmand but this scent has completely changed my mind. She is signature scent worthy and the only scent that I want to smell like. I want my entire body, house, and being to smell like this fragrance. She is just so rosey and beautiful. <br />
~ My absolute favorite of all of the MFK fragrances. ❥</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2057597"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2057597#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2050841" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2050841" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Saad alzahrani"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869360"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Saad alzahrani" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2050841ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2050841" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869360">Saad alzahrani</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-03">02/03/24 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have new bottle 200ML for sale (Tester) <br />
My location is Saudi Arabia, Jeddah</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2050841"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2050841#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2043305" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2043305" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LouD23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338446"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1338446.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LouD23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/40-Knots-16445.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16445.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="40 Knots"title="40 Knots"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2043305ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2043305" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338446">LouD23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-27">01/27/24 01:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A La Rose is a beautiful, natural, fresh rose, just like pressing your nose to a fresh flower. However, it smells almost exactly like Paul Smith Rose, which I already have and which is a fraction of the cost. It doesn't last much longer than that one either. The Paul Smith has long been one of my favourite spring, summer fragrances, and it has the Green Tea note behind the roses, which makes them dewier than the Roses in this one. Unless Roses gets discontinued, I'll stick with that one because of the price, but it's good to know that this is out there if that one ever gets hard to find. But if it wasn't for the fact that an almost exact £20 version of this exists, I would definitely pay for a full bottle of A La Rose. The only issue is longevity due to them both being natural, fresh scents without any heavy base notes to carry them. But I don't think it's possible to achieve such a natural rose scent and get longevity without corrupting that to some degree. So it's forgivable despite the price of A La Rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2043305"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2043305#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2041605" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2041605" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Neryloo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/642675"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.642675.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Neryloo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/La-Fille-de-Berlin-17162.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17162.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Fille de Berlin"title="La Fille de Berlin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2041605ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2041605" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/642675">Neryloo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-25">01/25/24 09:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really pretty citrusy rose that reminds me of a yellow rose. This is definitely for the Clean Girl Aesthetic girlies and it is fresh and delicate.  However the longevity isn't there for me and the sillage isn't what I would expect from a $250 2.4 Oz bottle of perfume. It's not extraordinary enough to warrant that price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2041605"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2041605#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2040943" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2040943" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nichoa99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846366"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1846366.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nichoa99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Liquides-Imaginaires/Blanche-Bete-70189.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70189.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche Bête"title="Blanche Bête"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2040943ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2040943" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846366">nichoa99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-24">01/24/24 16:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bright, citrusy rose! Very pretty</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2040943"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2040943#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033382" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033382" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nocciola23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466858"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466858.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nocciola23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-55997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"title="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033382ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033382" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466858">Nocciola23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very mild, watery rose scent. <br />
Barely there, very forgettable. Not unpleasant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2033382"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2033382#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2017616" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2017616" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tshahb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tshahb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bortnikoff/Sans-Fleurs-63670.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63670.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sans Fleurs"title="Sans Fleurs"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2017616ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2017616" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579649">Tshahb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-02">01/02/24 04:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Strong fixative base, just like Homme A La Rose. Inexcusable for the price. There are hundreds of better rose fragrances for way less.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="2017616"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=2017616#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1998870" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1998870" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gpaisley"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1181355"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1181355.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gpaisley" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1998870ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1998870" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1181355">gpaisley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-11">12/11/23 18:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow! I'm surprised there is no "lychee" or "quince" listed in the notes of A La Rose MFK because I definitely get a faint whiff of an accord that reminds me the pale pink rose, quince / lychee, and Turkish delight aroma that you get in scents like Chanel Chance Eau Tendre (EDT), Vince Camuto Fiori, and First Love by Victoria's Secret [and Fancy Forever by Jessica Simpson]. <br />
<br />
***UPDATE: Today I re-tested A LA ROSE by MFK and it reminded me of I FANCY YOU by JESSICA SIMPSON (silver cap bottle).*** <br />
<br />
The main difference is that A La Rose is extraordinarily softly blended, there are no "screechy," tart, or "sharp" green or citrus edges like there are in some of the other fragrances mentioned in the same genre. <br />
<br />
If you are looking for a soft pale pink rose balanced with a hint of lychee or quince, and no added greenery or ivy, then I think you will enjoy this perfume! <br />
<br />
Of note, I don't think that A La Rose MFK is similar to scents like Chloe Roses de Chloe, Bath and Body Works Rose, or Yardley English rose - because all those scents have a green herbaceous ivy accord in them - at least to my nose. Whereas, I don't detect a herbaceous ivy accord in A La Rose MFK... it's gentler, softer, and sweeter. It's a pale pink scent whereas the others are like a pale pink scent with a dark forest green streak inside.<br />
<br />
Last but not least, when I compare A La Rose MFK (white label) to "l'eau A La Rose" MFK (pale pink label), l'eau A La Rose is like a very faint, watered down version of A La Rose but! with the addition of a very faint hint of rhubarb or curry note - similar to the one in the original Delina perfume. At least that is what it smells like to my nose, I'm sure others may experience it differently! However to me, l'eau A la Rose is like a much lighter watered down A La Rose with a hint of rhubarb or curry. My personal preference is that I prefer A La Rose MFK (white label). I hope that is helpful!<br />
<br />
UPDATE: As inserted in the text toward the top of my review, I re-tested A LA ROSE by MFK and it reminded me of I FANCY YOU by Jessica Simpson (silver cap bottle)!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1998870"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1998870#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1996108" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1996108" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Enrium"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.36833.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Enrium" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1996108ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1996108" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833">Enrium</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-08">12/08/23 13:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>À La Rose is a straightforward, fresh rose scent, dewy, sheer and rosewater-like. It is almost a soliflore, with citrus adding freshness to the opening and soft, clean musk in the base giving it a soft landing. It is reminiscent of perfumes like Paul Smith Rose or Perfumer's Workshop Tea Rose, except that those are both bargains, unlike this. However, ALR is a beautifully-rendered, photorealistic wild rose in a bottle, bright and fresh initially, softening into a delicately powdery rose as it progresses. <br />
<br />
ALR is rosy from initial spray, dewy like rosewater, with some citrus adding freshness. I mostly get sweet orange. As it develops, the rose becomes more powdery, due in part to the violet. There is a subtle make-up quality to it as a result, but it remains primarily a rose scent. <br />
<br />
It becomes predictably musky as it fades, with soft woody notes rounding it out. The rose remains until final fade, light and delicate. Sillage and longevity are moderate. <br />
<br />
A softly feminine scent that is made for warm weather, ALR is an elegant, high-quality everyday scent for rose lovers. It is utterly timeless and classic in style, but is nothing groundbreaking and is expensive in comparison to similar scents. 3/5.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1996108"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1996108#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1985851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1985851" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rosiewebber"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rosiewebber" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1985851ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1985851" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480732">Rosiewebber</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-26">11/26/23 13:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a lovely one. It opens with bright citrus that softens into a sweet and fresh pink rose. It’s delicate and extremely feminine, it conjures up images of pretty pink dresses twirling in the summertime. There’s nothing powdery or cloying about this rose, she’s fresh and new.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1985851"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1985851#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1983773" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
