I think this is the most natural pink Rose in perfumery</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1983773"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1983773#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1981428" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1981428" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ailee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/999224"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.999224.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ailee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Tears-From-The-Moon-73560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tears From The Moon"title="Tears From The Moon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1981428ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1981428" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/999224">Ailee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-20">11/20/23 20:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i have a few rose perfumes,TF Rose Prick, Dior Rose and Roses, Aerin Evening Rose, LV Rose Des Vents, you name em, BUT..A La Rose is a game changer....i can change my minds many times about rose perfumes but I always go back to this. It's beautiful smooth creamy milky rose thats so delicate and lovely...I imagine LISA from the movie Wicker Park to wear this, perfect for her. this will be my ultimate rose perfume ever.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1981428"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1981428#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1969272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1969272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="belladonnaofsadness"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1609698"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1609698.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="belladonnaofsadness" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1969272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1969272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1609698">belladonnaofsadness</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-05">11/05/23 10:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rose might be my second favorite floral note so I was ready to dive into this with an open heart and even hoped it'd be a more simplistic profile. And after sitting with it for a bit I can definitively say it smells exactly like rose water and has the longevity of it as well. I'd get the exact same effect if I went to my local botanica and filled up a spray bottle of the rose water bottles that are usually near the Florida Water colognes. Buy, I don't know, literally anything else? We can't keep rewarding this kind of behavior.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1969272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1969272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966849" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Woolly Israelita"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1606201"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1606201.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Woolly Israelita" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Swiss-Arabian/Shaghaf-Oud-50582.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50582.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shaghaf Oud"title="Shaghaf Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1606201">Woolly Israelita</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 10:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think this is gorgeous! I love everything about A La Rose.<br />
Please, do us a good one Clone Houses &amp; release "Ooh Lala Rose"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1966849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1966849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1963316" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1963316" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="J&#039;aimeunefragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1640462"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1640462.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="J&#039;aimeunefragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1963316ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1963316" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1640462">J&#039;aimeunefragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-28">10/28/23 23:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Easy, cute &amp; forgettable. <br />
My first empty :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1963316"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1963316#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1955905" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1955905" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1955905ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1955905" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-19">10/19/23 08:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is probably the only perfume by Maison Francis Kurkdijan that I really like! It is very feminine, sweet, floral, classy, sophisticated and romantic smelling. As per the description, it does really smell like something that Marie Antoinette would wear... I can imagine her with her white powdered hair piled up high and dressed in a powder blue roccoco dress while holding a pink rose as I smell this!<br />
<br />
À La Rose opens up with a bright and happy citrus smell from both the bergamot and the orange, but it doesn't overpower the composition and is very similar to the citric nuances you'd find in a real rose.<br />
<br />
I then smell a very sweet, powdery, lush, romantic and naturalistic pink rose that tickles my nostrils and makes me breathe a happy sigh of relief. It smells very quintessentially French, like a field of roses in Grasse. I smell the violet the most after the rose and it emphasizes the powderiness one finds in a rose. I sense a hint of magnolia too, but it is only faint.<br />
<br />
I finally smell a hint of the musk and cedar wood in the dry down, but it is only very subtle and it adds depth, dimension and longevity to À La Rose's composition. It doesn't take away from the rosy smell of this fragrance too and I can also smell more of the violet in the dry down as it dissipates.<br />
<br />
<br />
This perfume lasted an impressive 10 and a half hours on me and its sillage was a happy medium, so it definitely wouldn't offend anyone or choke anyone out and I think it is office safe. I feel like it would smell great in both the spring and the summer too.<br />
<br />
This isn't my absolute favorite rose fragrance ever, (that title goes to Rose Absolue by Annick Goutal) but I'd say it is a close second for me. All in all, I'd give À La Rose by Maison Francis Kurkdijan an 8.8/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1955905"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1955905#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1953285" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1953285" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Moein_Ashraf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262530"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1262530.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Moein_Ashraf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Coeur-Battant-57129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cœur Battant"title="Cœur Battant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1953285ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1953285" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262530">Moein_Ashraf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-16">10/16/23 09:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's inspired by Marie Antoinette's beautiful painting with rose . In general, it smells like a bouquet of wet and freshly picked roses . If you are a rose fan, you must try it ! 🌹❤️🌹</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1953285"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1953285#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1950096" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1950096" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Merf21"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846221"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1846221.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Merf21" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1950096ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1950096" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846221">Merf21</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-12">10/12/23 09:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got a sample. At first spray it was a lovely rose but then it quickly turned to a very synthetic sweet melon. I asked my kids what smelled like and they said "grandma"  ?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1950096"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1950096#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1947641" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1947641" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ca3na"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174396"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1174396.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ca3na" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Babycat-73149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Babycat"title="Babycat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1947641ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1947641" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174396">Ca3na</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-09">10/09/23 04:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh opening, very beautiful &amp; quite a simple rose fragrance. Dry down is powdery. <br />
<br />
My daughter told me I smelt like an old person after I sprayed this perfume on, but I enjoy it &amp; think it smells pretty so I will continue to wear it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1947641"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1947641#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1941658" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Einfinken"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1840930"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Einfinken" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Santal-Blanc-55226.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55226.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Blanc"title="Santal Blanc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1941658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1941658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1840930">Einfinken</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-01">10/01/23 07:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am so, so picky with my roses. I like roses in real life, but I'm usually not a fan when it comes to rose in perfumes. I often find them to be just too overwhelming and cloying and the very sweet jammy roses can really turn my stomach or set off a migraine. The more sensual, deep roses give me old dusty dirty vibes. There have been roses I like but I've never encountered a true rose perfume that I would say I love, but I love a la Rose. <br />
<br />
This is the freshest, brightest, most realistic rose fragrance I have ever smelled. When I spray this, I am sitting in a rose garden in the early morning. There's dew on the grass and  there are fresh cut roses on the table. Maybe there's a lemon tree in this garden as well. This is not a dark heavy gothic rose, rather it is light and bright and happy. This is so feminine and pretty and I also think it's one of those scents that feels just ageless/timeless. A young girl could wear this as well as a more mature woman. In terms of performance, a la Rose has moderate projection (this is no BR 50) and lasts about 3-4 hours. I also think it will be a bit too fresh and bright for really cold days but for the realism of the rose itself none of this matters to me. I'll happily reapply and at the expense of my bank account, happily rebuy as well. <br />
<br />
I have been playing around with layering this with a woodier scent in the cooler mornings (specifically Santal Blanc by Van Cleef and Arpels) to help give it a bit more depth and I am liking the combo. It's still a fresh rose but the extra woody boost just helps ground it some.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1941658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1941658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1937472" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1937472" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="auror"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164080"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.164080.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="auror" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1937472ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1937472" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164080">auror</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-26">09/26/23 00:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opening is amazing, fresh cheerful and rosy that is not overwhelming. When it drydowned, it became a powdery rose scent that resembles classic rose turkish delight. It is a very calm scent overall, not a head turner. Honestly, it is pleasant but somehow giving a vibe of an old lady scent, or even and old gentleman to me. Maybe it is because it resemblances me the holiday/festive times in my childhood that when we visit elder family members and they serves some turkish delight with turkish coffee or tea. It would be better in winter and fall. Definitely not suitable for a blind buy imo.<br />
<br />
Update: After few more hours, the powdery scent has been toned down and it became more beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1937472"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1937472#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1929554" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1929554" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mejevika"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/931876"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.931876.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mejevika" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Quattro-Pizzi-91640.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91640.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Quattro Pizzi"title="Quattro Pizzi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1929554ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1929554" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); Hard pass</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1929554"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1929554#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1920920" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1920920" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="IrinaRen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1331653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1331653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="IrinaRen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1920920ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1920920" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); Then quickly moves into the almost Turkish delight rose scent to me maybe it’s not a fresh rose as its heaviness is enhanced by musk. Nice every day scent if you like rose, but not mind blowing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1920920"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1920920#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1914036" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912549" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lilah_lilah2023"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1767593"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1767593.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lilah_lilah2023" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912549ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912549" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1767593">Lilah_lilah2023</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-27">08/27/23 02:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is a wonderful, fresh, greenish rose, not old-lady like at all, instead it is quite pungent and vibrant. Must be the bergamot/ citrusy notes in it, which makes it a bit sour (more than L'Eau À La Rose, which is a lot lighter and a bit sweeter). I wish there was a version with peony in it as well. Overall it is just wonderful. But it may not be the most original, groundbreaking scent and the price is too much. The drydown is a bit soapy. I personally prefer l'Eau.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1912549"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1912549#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1907789" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1819902">smithaker</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-21">08/21/23 11:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you're a rose fanatic or purist, this will really appeal to you. There is a bit of citrus in the opening but it moves quickly to a classic powdery rose scent with good longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1907789"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1907789#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1902180" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1902180" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Amphora"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1811675"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1811675.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Amphora" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Akro/Bake-81614.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81614.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bake"title="Bake"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1902180ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1902180" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1811675">Amphora</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 14:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bergamot and fruity rose right off the bat at the opening feels exciting and invigorating but it quickly becomes a violet and classic rose scent. Very floral and feminine, turns sweet at the end. Lovely opening but not terribly exciting beyond the top notes. <br />
<br />
Ce Soir Ou Jamais by Goutal has the same vibe as the opening volley of notes with a turkish rose that feels like a mix between pear, rose, and champagne, but maintains that invigorating bubbly feeling throughout the lifespan of the fragrance rather than losing it less than halfway through.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1902180"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1902180#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1893144" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1893144" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nurtenka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/146566"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.146566.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nurtenka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Matiere-Premiere/Radical-Rose-66043.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66043.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Radical Rose"title="Radical Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1893144ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1893144" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/146566">nurtenka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-03">08/03/23 05:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm very picky when it comes to rose fragrances. I have even collection of different rose essential oils and like to smell them from time to time. <br />
Back to this perfume; initially it reminds of a delicate, fresh rose, however a few minutes later, after citruses disappear, it doesn't stand out as a designer perfume anymore. <br />
It is not bad, but it lacks something... some depth and sophistication I guess.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1893144"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1893144#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1885025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1885025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Obsidian100"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791181"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Obsidian100" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1885025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1885025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); The magnolia and orange make this warm and fresh at the same time... Very simple and straightforward, very easy to wear. I think this would be great for layering.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1885025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1885025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1876157" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1876157" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kai.laidla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/170074"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.170074.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kai.laidla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Step-Aboard/Milano-Centrale-57002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Milano Centrale"title="Milano Centrale"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1876157ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1876157" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/170074">kai.laidla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-11">07/11/23 07:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not for rose connoisseurs. <br />
But it would be a great gift for an 8 year old girl as her first perfume or for an 88 year old for Proust effect as it is easy to understand and it’s not overly complicated. <br />
Doesn’t smell like real rose, but more of a memory of something rose scented. I detect more synthetic molecules as well as white musk.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1876157"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1876157#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1874815" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1874815" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cristina S."/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1626119"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1626119.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cristina S." style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/J-adore-210.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.210.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="J'adore"title="J'adore"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1874815ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1874815" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1626119">Cristina S.</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-09">07/09/23 10:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried this in a store and I instantly loved it. It is a very natural smelling rose, very elegant and adult. I may be biased as I love rose as a note, but this is great to me. I wish I had this perfume, but I don't think I'll ever buy it because it's pretty expensive for my standards. On me it lasted for a long time, although it stayed pretty close to the skin. If you don't like rose, skip this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1874815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1874815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1873327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1873327" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AlexandraRoseD"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1744436"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1744436.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AlexandraRoseD" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Guilty-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-Pour-Femme-71377.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71377.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Intense Pour Femme"title="Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Intense Pour Femme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1873327ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1873327" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1744436">AlexandraRoseD</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-07">07/07/23 08:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice rose scent, a little bit creamy.<br />
Longevity on clothes (natural fabrics) is 6 hours, arm length projection. <br />
<br />
Very linear and no surprises. Feminine and delicate, appropriate for the office.<br />
<br />
I will use my 11 ml decant from the discovery set, but don't think I will purchase a full bottle.<br />
<br />
Looking for somthing less creamier, sharper, and non-linear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1873327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1873327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1863587" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
Again, <br />
DM me for photos and pricing!  =)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1863587"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1863587#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1855129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1855129" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="denisa_iv"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252395"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="denisa_iv" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Oud-Satin-Mood-30352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Satin Mood"title="Oud Satin Mood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1855129ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1855129" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252395">denisa_iv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-13">06/13/23 01:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get a sweet but not jammy rose. It's probably the mix with the citruses that makes this scent almost fruity in the beginning because it's still very sweet and it's still rose, it's not a realistic or forward citrus at all. This almost fruity note gives it a very youthful vibe and I imagine people who don't usually go for rose scents because they associate it with a "grandma smell" would still like this one. Same for people who dislike stronger, more balsamic and jammy sweet roses like perfumes from the rose-oud profile. They would probably like this as it's very different. <br />
While it has this youthful energy, it's also very nicely blended and more expensive smelling, it's not young in a bad way. It's just meant to be balanced and trying to please everyone, kind of like BR540 does. Like that one, it's also fruitier in the beginning, but then becomes airy and woody. All in all, to me it seems like a very MFK way to do a rose scent.<br />
I have tried so many rose perfumes over the years and I generally like a more rose forward, warm spicy and balsamic rose (I absolutely loved TF's Cafe Rose for a while). This has also a strong fresh note, that unfortunately, on my skin at least, reminds me too much of a detergent midway through. As it settles with those woody base notes, this perfume becomes more unisex imo, which might again please some people.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1855129"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1855129#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1853153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Musk gives good grip for longevity. And yes, it's simply beautiful juice from Kurkdjian.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1853153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1853153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1849973" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1849973" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chosesvert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1765388.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="chosesvert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1849973ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1849973" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); That being said, I like my perfumes to be a little more complex or even wandering, and this is very singular and specific.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1849973"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1849973#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1835313" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751834">Angela33</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-17">05/17/23 08:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I sprayed this fragrance, the first thought that came to mind was this is what Jesus's Rose Garden probably smells like!! It's beautiful</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1835313"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1835313#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1833213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1833213" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumelovere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196236"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumelovere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1833213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1833213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196236">perfumelovere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-14">05/14/23 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very rose forward scent to my nose, almost too much for my preference. I definitely pick up on the Kurkdjian usage of citrus which I think adds a tinge of sophistication to what I was going to describe as a singular rose. While it's a bit too literal for me, I do find it to also be harmoniously blended with the other notes. As far as longevity and sillage, I find pretty much every fragrance turns into a skin scent on me these days except for a rare few. I guess we all never have to worry about overspraying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1833213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1833213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1827943" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1827943" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ayshee_x"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1435558"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1435558.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ayshee_x" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Flora-Gorgeous-Magnolia-83621.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83621.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flora Gorgeous Magnolia"title="Flora Gorgeous Magnolia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1827943ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1827943" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1435558">ayshee_x</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-08">05/08/23 13:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very pleasant rose scent but the longevity is incredibly poor considering how expensive MFK perfumes are. I actually prefer the Eau de toilette version of this as it’s fresher. <br />
I also think it’s sort of basic and there’s lots of perfumes with similar rose notes that are a lot cheaper.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1827943"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1827943#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1824339" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/292309">mirrorghost</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-03">05/03/23 20:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this opens with fresh rose and bergamot-it's a light and springy rose. then a synthetic musk comes out. i really don't get many of the other notes, if at all. just rose, musk and bergamot. a light, almost soliflore rose. alright but not my personal favorite when it comes to rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
