It’s pretty but really simple. Save your money for something interesting. That being said, it’s my most complimented fragrance, and I have a lot 🤷♀️</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1818606"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1818606#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1813946" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1813946" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Xela_529"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545982"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1545982.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Xela_529" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ella-K-Parfums/Melodie-D-Altai-48471.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48471.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Melodie D'Altai"title="Melodie D'Altai"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1813946ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1813946" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545982">Xela_529</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-21">04/21/23 01:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a like for me, not a love. A La Rose is a sparkling, well-blended and clean rose. My one critique is it’s not exactly ground breaking. It’s definitely high quality as we shouldn’t expect anything less from MFK, but the scent itself is somewhat regular. 6/10<br />
<br />
Update: I’m starting to appreciate this more and more. The more I smell her the more I realize how effortlessly elegant she is. I’m starting to think I like this better than Delina. (I know Delina and ALR aren’t similar, but I’m not a huge rose fan so I’m sticking with the beginners) A La Rose isn’t screechy one bit; while I like Delina there is a slightly screechy element to it. I’m also picking up on the magnolia note in A La Rose. It blends so nicely with the rose. <br />
<br />
Another timeless classic from Mr. Kurkdjian.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1813946"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1813946#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1810007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1810007" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missloveschocolate"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/68454"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.68454.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missloveschocolate" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Un-Bois-Vanille-478.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.478.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Bois Vanille"title="Un Bois Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1810007ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1810007" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/68454">missloveschocolate</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-16">04/16/23 01:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First of all, I mostly don’t like rose - they can be 50 shades of bad to worse for me. However I did manage to find some rose perfumes over the years that I quite like. Hermessence rose ikebana, ADP Rosa nobile just to name a few. A la rose is quite similar to Rosa nobile, although Rosa is warmer, sunnier while à la rose is a morning rose, fresh, luxurious. A fancy garden of an old chateau, surrounded by citrus trees and green leaves, with water drops on the leaves, early in the morning. Rose nobile is warmed up, still fresh but sunnier, just as classy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1810007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1810007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1803865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1803865" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dcjimr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1186069.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dcjimr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1803865ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1803865" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069">dcjimr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-08">04/08/23 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do like this quite a bit, but it quickly turn into a skin scent on me.  Because of the poor longevity and sillage, I will have to pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1803865"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1803865#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1803845" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1803845" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jessica_chinos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1700820.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jessica_chinos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Eros-Pour-Femme-Eau-de-Toilette-39355.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39355.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eros Pour Femme Eau de Toilette"title="Eros Pour Femme Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1803845ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1803845" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700820">jessica_chinos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-08">04/08/23 11:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent smells like cooking cream with rose flavor, no sugar added. It's too literally creamy for me, it makes me feel my mouth milky even, as if I could taste it. I like the aroma, just not full bottle worthy considering the price tag. I mean, you can tell that this scent is high quality, and being a rose fragrance it doesn't go madame or old lady. But it's justo too expensive. Roses Greedy by Mancera would be a cheaper alternative. And for the price tag, I think I'd go for Rose D'Amalfi by Tom Ford, I really enjoyed it and is a little bit darker, fresh and more profound than this one, in my opinion. Where I live, it gets really hot in spring and summer, I mean 40ºC hot.  I don't think this fragrance would do well in the summer where I live... it's too thick and creamy, in my opinion.<br />
<br />
I like this scent, it just doesn't fascinate me, and I will not spend that kind of money just to use this perfume 30 days a year (when the weather stays between 15ºC-26º).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1803845"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1803845#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799947" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799947" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellslikecoffee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1663133"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1663133.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellslikecoffee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799947ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799947" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1663133">smellslikecoffee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-04">04/04/23 00:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin, it's not the fresh green rose as described in other reviews at all. <br />
<br />
For me it smells a bit musty. Reminds me of my grandmother. I love her, but I don't want to smell like her. I do love the smell of roses. I have quite a lot of them in my garden. But I guess they simply don't work out for me in frags. <br />
<br />
Ah well, another learning experience I guess.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1799947"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1799947#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1794356" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1794356" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HannahRosesAreRed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1705684.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HannahRosesAreRed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Bubble-Bath-60105.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60105.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bubble Bath"title="Bubble Bath"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1794356ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1794356" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705684">HannahRosesAreRed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-27">03/27/23 21:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Maison Francis Kurkdjian is a solid brand with some showstopping fragrances. While I'm not a huge fan of Baccarat Rouge–way too medicinal and heavy on the ambergris for my tastes–I do rather like Á La Rose. It's a nice, approachable, user-friendly and accessible rose, floral fragrance. It's not necessarily groundbreaking–combining citrus, musk and light woods with rose is nothing new. However, this familiarity is part of the appeal of this fragrance. For what it does, it does it well. This is a soft, clean rose–nothing too fancy. It's quite balanced, with the other notes–mainly the top citrus notes and the bottom musk note–enhancing the main rose heart scent rather than accompanying it. <br />
<br />
The wood notes at the base–mainly the rather green hint of cedar–adds to the high-quality appeal of this fragrance. It adds that natural, aquatic edge that most other woods do not, and pairs well with the slightly powdery musk profile. Although violet and magnolia are listed in the fragrance profile, they are all but lost in the sea of rose, which is too bad. <br />
<br />
I do like this scent a lot. It's a good perfume for work, daywear, and perhaps could be useful for evening events. It's sweet, fresh, comforting and familiar. While a tad predictable–and there are many other impressive rose fragrances with similar scent profiles–Á La Rose is a solid and appealing fragrance with a broad appeal. I can't imagine many people disliking this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1794356"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1794356#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1792037" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1792037" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mad_mal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1561708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mad_mal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1792037ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1792037" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561708">mad_mal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-25">03/25/23 00:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>IMO, slight similarity with Chance eau tendre EDP than EDT. The citruses in MFK a la rose is sweeter though. Very nice for spring and summer. If you really want to smell prominently of roses or if you want a photorealistic rose, this might not be for you. To me, the roses take the second stage in this. Dries off really sweet on my skin. I like it, but for me, it's not worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1792037"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1792037#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1789073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1789073" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CeeLeeBee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1002997"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1002997.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="CeeLeeBee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Damask-60086.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60086.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Damask"title="Damask"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1789073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1789073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1002997">CeeLeeBee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-21">03/21/23 11:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells so much like Chance eau Tendre EDP in the drydown that I'm shocked to see it's not listed as a similar fragrance. Both are soft, warm floral, and not particularly rosy. I love a la Rose, but it's not as rose forward as I expected given its name. It's warm, sweet, soft, a bit citrusy, a bit musky. Lovely scent, just not that rosy imo. The sillage and longevity are also not great considering the price point. I'll pass on a fb of this one and just stick with Chance eau Tendre.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1789073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1789073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1784390" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missile414"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1688200"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1688200.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missile414" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1784390ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1784390" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1688200">missile414</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-15">03/15/23 16:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I hate the opening of this, too much citrus for me. As it dries down a pretty rose lingers for a few hours so it’s hard for me to say whether I enjoy it or not. Once I get past the first 20 minutes I will say it’s very lovely. At the price point though I don’t think it’s worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1784390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1784390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1776624" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1776624" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tam.nguyen98"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701036"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="tam.nguyen98" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1776624ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1776624" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701036">tam.nguyen98</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-06">03/06/23 14:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ohhh no.....this fragrance is not for the younger generation(generally). The citrus and powdery notes clash with each other, in my opinion. Imagine baby powder and sourness together....I mean, this is like a fresh light sour rose fragrance, though. I will totally love this if it's not powdery because this scent is super similar to rose petals. Hence, I wear the Une Rose by Frederic Malle instead. It's a little darker but it is most similar to the rose petals scent so far. My mom prefers this scent instead of Une rose because it's lighter and fresher than Une rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1776624"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1776624#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1763509" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1763509" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JoyousOne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1599257"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1599257.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JoyousOne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rosendo-Mateu-Olfactive-Expressions/1970-80352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1970"title="1970"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1763509ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1763509" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1599257">JoyousOne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-18">02/18/23 20:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I lady at the Maison Francis Kurkdjian counter told me that it takes 700 tons to make 1 pound of pure rose oil and that 400 roses are in each bottle. This opens like a rose garden in heaven and then gets too perfumy like specialized soap. This is a skin scent. Lovely story about the plethora of roses in each bottle but other than that, nothing to right home about. I prefer the roses in Dior's Blooming Bouquet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1763509"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1763509#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1757932" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1757932" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="violeteme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="violeteme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sisley/Sisley-Eau-de-3-5852.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5852.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sisley Eau de 3"title="Sisley Eau de 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1757932ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1757932" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189">violeteme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-11">02/11/23 17:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh wow... This is THE ROSE. Bravo Francis Kurkdjian. This is a dream. It is a proud garden rose, almost a true smell, with all the nuances of that citrusy tinge full-blooming roses have. It smells like a rose in her most glorious days, petals just unfurled, young, but mature bloom on sunny days. This is femininity in a bottle. It makes me week in the knees, such beauty. Don't bother with the "similar to/reminds me of" comparisons, there is no other perfume that smells exactly like this. None of the mentions can compare. Delina is A la Rose's futuristic sister, she is all neon, latex, ultra-chemical. And A la Rose is a natural, fragile and tender beauty. I wish it lasted just a bit longer. But this is a perfect pink, fresh, dewy, true rose scent for everyday wear, morning glow, relaxation before bed... It feels like immersing yourself in an eternal beauty fountain. K-beauty admirers could love this.<br />
<br />
Update: Been testing this from my decant for two months now and I just can't get enough of it, it seems so simple, but what a true perfection, this is what true luxury is, a simple thing made to such heights. Easily the best dewy, pink, soft rose I have ever smelled in my life. Let's hope it never goes through reformulations. On the skin it barely stays on few hours, but on fluffy cotton garments - three days.<br />
<br />
Another update: One perfume that might come close to this is Un Zeste de Rose by Les Perfumes de Rosine. But Rosine's version is even more citrus forward, it seems.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1757932"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1757932#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1748709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1748709" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sophia97"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sophia97" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Bright-Crystal-Absolu-21547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bright Crystal Absolu"title="Bright Crystal Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1748709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1748709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670870">Sophia97</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-31">01/31/23 23:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you want to smell rich, wear this. PERFECT in every way!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1748709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1748709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1742690" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1742690" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nanaa_from_ghana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nanaa_from_ghana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1742690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1742690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671">nanaa_from_ghana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-24">01/24/23 22:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For what it’s worth, it’s definitely a high quality rose perfume. My only issues are the price (considering how weak it is in terms of sillage) and the strength of the citrus here. It almost feels like the rose notes and citrus notes are in competition for the center spot. The longevity is good, as are most MFK fragrances but you really need to spray this one in order to get a good scent bubble. She’s beautiful, but I have many other rose scents in my collection that I like more than this. <br />
<br />
I think this is the perfect rose for someone who wants splurge on a really classy, likable, soft rose. My favorite fresh rose to date is Aerin Bamboo Rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1742690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1742690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1736987" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324123">Verrucosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-17">01/17/23 14:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's nothing really wrong with this but it's not the rose for me. It's too nice, too "clean," too crystalline. It smells like the very colour pink and makes me feel slightly queasy. I can see many people loving it, though, for the very qualities that are turning my stomach. I could even see smelling this on another person and thinking it's nice and breezy and chic, just not on myself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1736514"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1736514#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1734283" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1734283" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KELIZ"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1658449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="KELIZ" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Astor-Place-5606.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5606.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Astor Place"title="Astor Place"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1734283ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1734283" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1658449">KELIZ</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-14">01/14/23 21:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the cleanest rose scent I’ve ever come across. It’s a very linear fragrance &amp; a perfect specimen rose without any powder or other accents to cloud it. I’ve tried many rose scents in the niche as well as designer markets &amp; this is definitely the cleanest uncomplicated rose with lasting power. It stays a fresh youthful rose even at dry down. <br />
It feels to me like fresh rose petals floating on ice water in a sparkling crystal dish.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1734283"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1734283#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1732081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030135">laura710</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-12">01/12/23 06:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a strange fragrance. The most delicate, soft and tender rose, almost transparent, with violet and citrusy notes, and a strange cold, dry, stern green note that I cannot identify. Almost like paper. It is a beautifully soft rose petal one moment, and the next it is a strange paper envelope with flowers inside, catching me off guard. Definitely unique. A bit sad and melancholic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1732081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1732081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1727416" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; 🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸🌸</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1721431"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1721431#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1716148" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1716148" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mervozz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1611084"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mervozz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1716148ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1716148" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1611084">Mervozz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-23">12/23/22 23:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My late grandfather had velvet-covered, rose-scented prayer beads that were stored in a box. Smells exactly like those! Realistic, fresh &amp; pretty but its longevity is a joke and I don't want to smell like prayer beads 😂 I have the MFK discovery set.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1716148"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1716148#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1709029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1709029" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ca$hm3re"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580772"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1580772.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ca$hm3re" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Sweet-Like-Candy-39970.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39970.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sweet Like Candy"title="Sweet Like Candy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1709029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1709029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580772">ca$hm3re</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-14">12/14/22 06:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Best true rose fragrance I’ve come across, not vintage-y, not jammy. Just your typical light pink rose scent. Linear though, and for that price tag, there’s no way😬</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1709029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1709029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1702614" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1702614" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CeeTee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1420837"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1420837.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CeeTee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Original-Vetiver-468.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.468.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Original Vetiver"title="Original Vetiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1702614ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1702614" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1420837">CeeTee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-05">12/05/22 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’m sorry to say….<br />
I have a few MFK creations. This is my least favorite, though certainly not bad. I take no pleasure is saying that it’s not very interesting. It starts out as a citrusy Grasse rose. It’s a bright and standard rose.:It’s not deep, but light. Then, it goes super green, like slicing the stem vertically and smelling its innards. It’s pretty bitter to me at this phase. Far less basic than it started. <br />
<br />
It’s a simple/minimalist concoction that’s just a little unique. I’m not sure that the unique twist is an improvement. It’s not bad, by any means. It’s just not great, for me. It kind of feels like one of his drop dead gorgeous EDPs, but mixed with the bitterness of his Acqua Universalis creations: bitter with citrus.<br />
<br />
I know many people who adore those: Celestia, etc. I don’t like them, unfortunately, and I think that’s what is turning me off.  If you like those and pink rose notes, you may like this.<br />
<br />
Please don’t come for me, but<br />
I was reading an interview with Kurkdjian, and he stopped just short of saying he didn’t like this fragrance. A la Rose came after Grand Soir Absolue (no longer in production.) He received much critical acclaim for GSA. He, himself, felt it was a masterpiece. However, no one actually purchased it. He actually only sold 28 bottles of GSA world-wide, in one whole year. <br />
He was feeling commercial pressure.  He said that he created á la Rose to ‘keep the lights on’ at the company…He felt like he had to create something that would sell, so he could continue on with what he felt were his more artistic creations, since he had 17 employees (with 17 families) that he felt responsible for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1702614"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1702614#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1701472" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495602">Lucky121</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-03">12/03/22 14:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells so nice. I am a guy and I wear this. The orange is unreal.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1701472"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1701472#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1699906" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1699906" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dramaloladiva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1309211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dramaloladiva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Gris-Montaigne-17842.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17842.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Montaigne"title="Gris Montaigne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1699906ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1699906" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309211">Dramaloladiva</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-01">12/01/22 10:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a well behaved rose. Shy, a little citrusy, green but at the same time slightly sweet but very slightly (at least, to my nose). <br />
This is the kind of fragrance you’d wear if you were to meet your future in-laws. To make a good impression. Nothing loud or offensive, on the contrary, poised, classy and oh so chic. À la Rose is a perfect white rose. Pure and delicate. <br />
A must try for rose lovers for sure! A  B I G  love from me but then again, I am a rose perfumes freak…🌹🌹🌹</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1699906"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1699906#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1694387" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1694387" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="diceee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1526090"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1526090.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="diceee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1694387ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1694387" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1526090">diceee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-23">11/23/22 04:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I liked this perfume (got a decant), but not enough to spend a hefty amount for a full bottle. While the scent is fresh, rosey, and clean that's perfect for the summer and humidity, the longevity is poor! It lasted in my skin for only about 1.5hrs and it's gone completely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1694387"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1694387#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1692197" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1692197" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lucky notes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1585319"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1585319.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lucky notes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Petit-Matin-40817.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40817.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Petit Matin"title="Petit Matin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1692197ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1692197" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1585319">Lucky notes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-19">11/19/22 22:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought is was a bit simple at first, but it keeps pulling me back. After being gifted a decant at Mecca by a lovely SA, I purchased some after polishing off the sample in a few days.<br />
<br />
On my skin, this is a simple and clean rose, with pared back supporting top notes of citrus and a strong base of salty, powdery musk. Sounds boring but is a delight. I love rose so this basic rose scent wows me - there are no surprises in it, just delicious top quality ingredients and skillful blend.<br />
<br />
Delightful for spring weather at the end of the day. I haven't tried it in cooler weather but it has a rich base. Surely a rose-lover could wear this in winter too? I will keep you posted.<br />
<br />
I find it a bit weak but maybe that is my nose in its 40s. I spray it quite heavily (around 4 sprays). Pricey but I still paid and use it liberally.<br />
<br />
Edit: a different SA has since showed me to combine this with Gentle Fluidity (either silver or gold). Makes the rose bigger, brighter! Even being weak, a la Rose is turning into one of my favourites!!!<br />
<br />
Edit #2 Cannot get enough. The rose is so bright with the citrus. Rose lovers be warned, this is addictive!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1692197"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1692197#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1690882" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1690882" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JoyDivision"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580180"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1580180.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JoyDivision" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Blooming-Bouquet-23280.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.23280.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet"title="Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1690882ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1690882" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580180">JoyDivision</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-18">11/18/22 00:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very fresh, playful citrusy rose fragrance. Well done, like all MFC perfumes but not necessarily innovative like some of their other scents. I actually bought it as it was referred to be similar to Baby Doll by YSL, one of my best spring perfumes in the 00's (y'all get nostalgic sometimes, don't you?). <br />
The opening is pretty similar to Baby Doll but instead of remaining a citrusy rose blast and fading away in a couple of hours, this one becomes a subtle rose perfume that lives up to its name till the end. The musk and the cedar are very faint but well put there to make the dry down deep, sweet and almost powdery. It's a great perfume for spring and summer and makes you feel optimistic, so make sure you wear it at the office.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1690882"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1690882#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1684477" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1684477" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="specialfairygirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112296"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1112296.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="specialfairygirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-for-Her-38497.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38497.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus for Her"title="Aventus for Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1684477ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1684477" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112296">specialfairygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-09">11/09/22 05:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a nice rose fragrance, but if you hate how real roses smell, it is not for you. As a rose lover (I'm talking about the flower scent), it is rare that I find a perfume that smells like roses. And this does. It is a bit sharp and quite strong and distinctive, so be prepared. Nevertheless, it is an artful re-creation, I wouldn't buy a full bottle but will use the sample I have been given and will enjoy it. More of a day fragrance on the feminine side. Perfect for the office, distinctive enough to show character, but not too harsh or nauseating. I am (an unlikely) fan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1684477"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1684477#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1683179" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1683179" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pat_Chouli"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/879005"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.879005.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pat_Chouli" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Rose-N-Roses-58562.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58562.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Rose N'Roses"title="Miss Dior Rose N'Roses"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1683179ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1683179" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/879005">Pat_Chouli</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-07">11/07/22 13:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hmmm, this is a sour rose on me. Rose is my favorite note, but there's something unfresh about this one to me. The citrus is too authentic, sour like the taste of a lemon. With no added sugar to balance it out. The effect is a stale rose, all stems and leaves with only a few pink petals. Also it has very low sillage and longevity. I don't like a lot of sweetness in my perfume, but I guess I do need some. This scent could definitely be unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1683179"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1683179#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1676717" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
