padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1562639">DachshundMama</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-29">10/29/22 07:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just had to add this review. I got it as sample from official webpage, and I hated it. I never reacting so strong on any perfumes. And most of the times really enjoy Rose smells. I wonder, if I can smell something others don't. Because after applying it, I immediately got nauseous and needed to wash it off. It took me 3 times to wash it and change my clothes. Reminded me time, when I got allergy reaction on red wine for the first time and felt so sick. Funny thing, that I forgot about it and after couple of weeks randomly spreyed it again just now and got same reaction. I literally laying now on sofa and trying not move how bad I feel. And I'm someone, who using Channel classics and loves oversweet perfumes, who everyone reviewing like "so sweet, I had nausea". BTW my spouse hated it too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1676717"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1676717#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1671553" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1671553" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cadentsun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1502149"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1502149.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cadentsun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1671553ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1671553" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1502149">cadentsun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-22">10/22/22 02:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a crystal clear, bright as day, just happy to be here, bashful pink rose. Very fresh, without being decidedly grassy or sour or overly wet-smelling, and it's neither dusty, dessert, nor detergent-like. It's natural, quaint, inoffensive, and somewhat... wimpy? I dunno, I love myself an all-occasions, modest, clean rose fragrance, but this one really wastes no time making itself scarce. I would be lying if I said I could pick up much of the non-rose notes, and I don't think the front-loaded performance is a musk anosmia issue. It's a shame, because the rose that is briefly captured really is so beautiful and refreshing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1671553"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1671553#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1667547" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1667547" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shikin27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473364"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1473364.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shikin27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Gabrielle-Essence-56076.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56076.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gabrielle Essence"title="Gabrielle Essence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1667547ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1667547" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473364">Shikin27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-16">10/16/22 16:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Edit: ok this doesn't smell as horrible as i made it seem at first. It's actually not that bad but I guess when you factor in the price it's pretty disappointing. this does smell so familiar. It's very soapy. Omg I think it smells of lux soap, the kind that we use to use when we were kids those hard soaps. Not the new, foamy makes-your-skin-soft ones they have now. It's the old ones that makes your skin squeak. Yes I think that is it. That's what this smells like. <br />
<br />
When I first got it: Absolutely shocked at how terrible this smells. Reading some of the less than favourable reviews here I thought people must be exaggerating but no it's spot on! This smells very, very familiar. I can't quite put my finger on it but it really smells like a cheap perfume not one that cost $300+</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1667547"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1667547#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1651862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I loved the sample I got so much I purchased a full bottle. Definitely not a "boss-girl" type fragrance but more for when you want to feel pulled together, refined, and professional. I would wear this at a job interview, it's poised without being heavy, I think both older and younger women could wear it easily.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10146">youreyes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-17">09/17/22 05:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A shrill, chalky citrus rose like so many others.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1646970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1646970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1639561" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1639561" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragrance_girl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185786"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragrance_girl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1639561ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1639561" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185786">fragrance_girl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-06">09/06/22 12:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The best rose perfume I've ever smelled. Great job Francis. <br />
<br />
No wonder it was initially released on Japanese market. Japanese enjoy more refined and minimalistic things, as opposed to some loud, complex and potent scents enjoyed in the West. It may be actually offensive to invade other people's personal space with a loud fragrance in Japan.<br />
<br />
The scent is elegant, wearable, pleasant, inoffensive, minimalistic. Light and feminine - beautiful. It's not sharp or heavy like many other rose fragrances may seem. <br />
<br />
I'm not a fan of rose perfumes but this is the only one I'd buy (MFK L'eau A La Rose, Cartier Pur Rose and Guerlain Rossa Rosa are among  the top as well).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1639561"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1639561#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1634240" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1634240" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nicheperfumelover23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1561211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nicheperfumelover23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1634240ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1634240" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561211">nicheperfumelover23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-30">08/30/22 06:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got this as a free sample and I really like it! What a pretty rose scent. It's light and fresh, ever so slightly sweet but not too sweet at all. I would not describe it as weak. It smells exactly like a fresh rose, so if that is what you are looking for, you will be happy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1634240"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1634240#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1633831" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1633831" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aviegravy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="aviegravy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/BDK-Parfums/Gris-Charnel-57038.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57038.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Charnel"title="Gris Charnel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1633831ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1633831" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427773">aviegravy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-29">08/29/22 14:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>super realistic dewy, slightly green rose + lemon.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1633831"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1633831#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1630453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1630453" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lindsayalyssa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246753"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lindsayalyssa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1630453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1630453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246753">Lindsayalyssa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-24">08/24/22 11:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not good. If you want to know how it smells, just wipe your body down with fragranced diaper wipes. No silage or longevity either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1630453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1630453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1627810" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1627810" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scouthome"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1278724"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1278724.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scouthome" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1627810ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1627810" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1278724">Scouthome</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-20">08/20/22 13:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with those who describe this as a safe or delicate rose and as a quiet rose. As that is indeed what it is to me as well. In the absolute initial whiff which is the moment I like the most with this fragrance it does indeed manage to capture the scent of a lighter pink rose petal with a dew drop sitting on it not yet picked up but still sitting in its natural habitat. In essence a very natural realistic fresh rose scent far away from the more cloying versions that we all have smelt one time or another on a grandmother or in a bubble bath somewhere. This is therefore an almost perfect delicate little rose for someone who would like to fall in love again with rose scents but are afraid of the cloying heavier bougie ones… <br />
<br />
Having said that I still find this a tiny bit boring, to be honest… it is so delicate and quiet that once the initial burst of fresh pink rose petal vanishes and leaves room for the dry down this becomes very faint on me, and I mean very faint to the point I need to work hard sometimes to even discern it. And I am not really a strong projection kind of girl but this is so faint that I believe it would be safe even in en environment with only people allergic to scents… <br />
<br />
if I really stick my nose into it once it has dried down what I then get is a mild powdery violet musky feel with a tiny reminder of cedar far far in the background and surrounded by a very very mild clean rose with a hint of citrus. So the notes are there, but oh so quiet and delicate. On me this lasts at most a few hours, and absolutely not until the next day. I admire those who do, as clearly some other reviewers do get a stronger projection and longer lasting effect from this which goes to show perfumes do wear individually!<br />
<br />
If you are choosing between this and the eau de toilette version l’ eau A La Rose I must say I personally prefer that to this. They are quite different though. The EdT l’eau is a more fruity sweet rose scent. Still a fresh pink rose. But with the fruity ness and the sweetness accompanying it and no powdery ness at all which changes the fragrance quite a bit. The EdT version also has stronger projection and lasts longer on me despite being a lesser concentration. It is also more girly in my opinion while the EdP A La Rose is more wearable for any sex at any age. Personally I like to mix them sometimes. <br />
<br />
In comparison with other lighter rose scents in my collection Byredo Young Rose is a lot more fruity citrusy. Armani Prive Rose Milano is a bit more mature and more powdery with stronger projection. Byredo (yet again) Rose of No Mans Land is similar to A la rose but with a more powerful performance and with perhaps a hint of red roses in the mix? Miss Dior Blooming bouquet is soapy and loud and a lot less sophisticated and Delina La Rose is a lot more sweet. ❣️</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1627810"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1627810#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1627655" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1627655" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jwen Liu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1094566"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jwen Liu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1627655ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1627655" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1094566">Jwen Liu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-20">08/20/22 08:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just fresh Rose..Fresh and clean...<br />
But not Sexy at all..<br />
Too expensive.. I think Penhaligon duches rose is better...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1627655"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1627655#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1623397" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1623397" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Trtmtn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1536969"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Trtmtn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Earl-Grey-Cucumber-11488.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11488.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Earl Grey & Cucumber"title="Earl Grey & Cucumber"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1623397ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1623397" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1536969">Trtmtn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-14">08/14/22 06:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't mind this. It's a pretty, fresh rose scent. However,  for the price it hasn't got enough sillage, longevity or wow factor to make it worthwhile in my view</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1623397"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1623397#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1622627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1622627" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SensitiveRecluse"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403680"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1403680.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SensitiveRecluse" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Skin-35244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Skin"title="Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1622627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1622627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403680">SensitiveRecluse</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-12">08/12/22 22:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So pretty! This is a fresher, more youthful, rose than Chloe. Soft rose and violets. Such a girly daytime fragrance. Perfect for brunch, picking flowers at a farm, or a wedding. However, this sits very close to the skin, and lasts 2 hours max-- even on top of Vaseline. If you're looking for a youthful rose, I would go with Turkish Rose from Nest instead- it lasts longer, it's jammy from the plum note, and you can get a travel size for less than $30. However, this is perfect if you're looking for luxurious gift for a bridal situation (bride, bridesmaids, Mother or MIL of the bride).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1622627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1622627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1610078" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1610078" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tanny_ups2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1533847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1533847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tanny_ups2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Eau-de-Parfum-2017-45202.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45202.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Eau de Parfum (2017)"title="Miss Dior Eau de Parfum (2017)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1610078ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1610078" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1533847">Tanny_ups2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-25">07/25/22 04:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Do not waste your money on this!! The longevity and sillage are poor. It’s too expensive for a skin scent that lasts 1 hour. No projection whatsoever. It’s a waste of money</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1610078"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1610078#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1608896" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1608896" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="okamikiera"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191651"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191651.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="okamikiera" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Santa-Maria-Novella/L-Iris-74288.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74288.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Iris"title="L'Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1608896ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1608896" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191651">okamikiera</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-23">07/23/22 07:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a lovely, palatable fresh rose. A bit greener and more critic than rose water, with the slightly synthetic orange blossom from Amyris Femme. Suffice to say this isn’t a very “rose” rose scent, quite diluted, but that may be preferable for those who don't want cloying rose. It works for the office, but for dates it's the perfume equivalent of a modest floor-length dress that doesn’t hug your figure. Too safe and toothless, to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1608896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1608896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1606934" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1606934" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Staretsi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1505543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1505543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Staretsi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1606934ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1606934" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); That's not a bad thing, by the way. She was an elegant lady who always smelled fabulous. She used to wear something very similar to this and I like it. This has a classic feel about it and not many wear this profile these days. <br />
<br />
7.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1606934"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1606934#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1606754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1606754" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gioia&#039;s secret"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1467187"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1467187.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gioia&#039;s secret" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1606754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1606754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1467187">Gioia&#039;s secret</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-20">07/20/22 04:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Recently I have tested fragrances and received lots of samples with a rose as a main note(Red Roses by Jo Malone, Rosa Rossa by Guerlain, Rose &amp; Tangerine by Chloe, La Rose by Diptyque) but A La Rose is the worst of them. It smells unpleasant and some notes in it make it smells cheap, I have tested in store L’Homme a la Rose and I can definitely say that I like it much more than a female version. Sillage and longevity are poor as well<br />
My favourite rose fragrances are La fille de Berlin by Serge Lutens for evening events; La Rose by diptyque, Rosa Rossa by Guerlain - everyday office-friendly scents</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1606754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1606754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1601954" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1601954" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Comrade Zagoryanskaya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369401"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1369401.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Comrade Zagoryanskaya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/L-orpheline-26214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'orpheline"title="L'orpheline"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1601954ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1601954" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369401">Comrade Zagoryanskaya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-12">07/12/22 23:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Took me a couple of wearings to appreciate this fragrance as it’s quiet to the point I barely felt it at first especially when comparing to other louder rose scents. However once I’ve applied it on one of the Summer mornings first thing after shower I could finally feel what a high quality and outstanding fragrance this is.  There’s a little “light blueish” (but much fainter) citrus in the beginning which quickly blends into a fresh sparkly rose and clean musk. And although it speaks in a low voice it amazingly lingers for hours and hours producing a vibe of class and tenderness. I imagine this is something Grace Kelly would wear. A pure understated luxury this one. <br />
PS Having said all that it’s still a “like”<br />
not “love” for me as I believe the price of FB is too steep for the quality especially if one acquires a wide variety of fragrances for their collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1594935" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lingggvs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1528640"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1528640.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lingggvs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1594935ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1594935" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1528640">lingggvs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-01">07/01/22 13:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a nice rose scent with a hint of coconut. It's nice but also SLIGHTLY reminds me of church. It's not something I can see myself wearing that often. It's definitely a more mature scent.<br />
<br />
edit: i decided to put this on as it has just been collecting dust on my shelf and i absolutely fell in love with it! the sillage is great and it lasts pretty long as well (it’s been about 8 hours and i can still smell it on me). it’s a very pretty rose scent that is slightly creamy and sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1594935"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1594935#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1589633" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1589633" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="risabunny"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1518120"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1518120.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="risabunny" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1589633ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1589633" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1518120">risabunny</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-22">06/22/22 18:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Despite not having any peony in it, this smell reminds me of Miss Dior blooming bouquet. Its a very close to skin scent, and if you take this into account, this lasts all day. I personally love this scent if I feel in the mood for a rosy subtle scent. Can not over spray this, and if you're into higher sillage scents, this is probably not for you. <br />
<br />
A true light rose scent. Sits close to skin. I recommend at a discounted price, not full price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1589633"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1589633#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1583585" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1583585" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toddc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489723"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="toddc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Tuxedo-32269.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32269.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tuxedo"title="Tuxedo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1583585ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1583585" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489723">toddc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-13">06/13/22 08:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know I know, A La Rose probably is one of the most popular fragrance by MFK but I just can't love it. It smells on my skin like plastic. It's gentle, romantic and soft but it just does not smell like fresh roses.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1583585"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1583585#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1575968" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1575968" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nikhil31"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1494190"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1494190.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nikhil31" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Layton-39314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Layton"title="Layton"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1575968ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1575968" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1494190">Nikhil31</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-01">06/01/22 22:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>10/10 Clean rose fragrance.<br />
<br />
I got a sample of this from lucky scent. Even though its marketed for women, it can suit men for more dressier occasions(definitely not a daily wear fragrance). We had roses in our garden while I was growing up, the rose here is very nostalgic and realistic. Ever so slightly powdery but in a good way. It's true potential is in warm weather when you just start sweating a little bit, the rose turns jammy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1575968"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1575968#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1568352" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1568352" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="venusingemini"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1507404"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1507404.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="venusingemini" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1568352ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1568352" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1507404">venusingemini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-21">05/21/22 07:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If nothing else, MFK is consistent. Even with such a soft, light fragrance like A La Rose, he manages to get a decent projection and great longevity. This is a beautiful, soft, elegant fragrance. It’s very playful, and fairy like in my opinion. I get a fresh, dewy pink rose with a little bit of green in it. It smells like walking through a garden after it’s rained. On my skin, the citrus notes (mostly orange) are very subtle but definitely come out to add a touch of sweetness. This is one that i fell in love with only after wearing it on my own skin. I liked it on the blotter card, but i LOVED it on my skin. The projection is quite good on me. It’s not like BR540, or one of the ouds but for a light floral it’s quite nice. I get anywhere from 8-10 hours from this even in the hot, humid weather and in fact i think the warmer weather makes the fragrance even better. To me, this is a more elegant, refined, and higher quality version of the Marc Jacobs Daisy perfumes. I think it was worth every penny and i will re purchase when i run out! It’s crazy to me that more people don’t talk about this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1568352"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1568352#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1567506" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1567506" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Trishaaa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458062"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Trishaaa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1567506ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1567506" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458062">Trishaaa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-19">05/19/22 22:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful, youthful, romantic and fresh take on a rose perfume. The rose in this is more like rose water than the flower itself in my opinion. There is citrus but it's nowhere close to being overpowering, and the rose is the main star of the show 100% all throughout. Only issue I've got here is the longevity and silage. It actually feels like it'd be good for the clothes or even hair and it'd be best in the summer or spring. I love this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1567506"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1567506#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1559971" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473792">Ceekel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-08">05/08/22 19:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of my favorite MFK fragrance.  This is a soft rose fragrance.  It does not have a huge silage but very moderate.  You may not be able to smell yourself, but others will.  Very safistagated fragrance.  The rose is not a mature rose but a younger rose.  You can wear this to a brunch, Sunday service, or on a picnic  definitely dull bottle worthy for me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1559971"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1559971#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1557354" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1557354" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vitriol08"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1215256"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vitriol08" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Silver-Oud-69051.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69051.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Silver Oud"title="The Library Collection Silver Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1557354ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1557354" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1215256">Vitriol08</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-04">05/04/22 22:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty, amazing, classy, simple yet deep.<br />
This is a very likeable, wearable rose and musk scent.<br />
So crowd pleasing.<br />
I got it for my wife who used to wear scents only occasionally and she is now wearing this very regularly as one of her daily signature scents.<br />
It starts with a gorgeous, vibrant, simple rose and dries down to a beautiful, long last floral musk.<br />
Total blind buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1557354"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1557354#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1557259" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1557259" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Elle&#039;s Bells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466853"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466853.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Elle&#039;s Bells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Caban-32267.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32267.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Caban"title="Caban"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1557259ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1557259" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466853">Elle&#039;s Bells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-04">05/04/22 18:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sampled this in Neiman's a month ago and I could not stop smelling myself. A la Rose is so pretty and feminine. This scent embodies a modern rose and is rounded out by a delicate touch of violet. To be honest, I can't stand BR 540, but FK is a master perfumer. I purchased a FB this week and I can't wait for it to arrive. Also, ALR has amazing longevity and a beautiful sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1557259"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1557259#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1549026" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1549026" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sniffing person"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310502"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1310502.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sniffing person" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cartier/Pure-Rose-78022.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78022.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pure Rose"title="Pure Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1549026ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1549026" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310502">sniffing person</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-23">04/23/22 00:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very safe rose. Not the red kind, but those light pink ones with thin, flexible stems and delicate fragrance. I own two bottles (I don't know why) and spray it whenever because that is what that scent is: whenever. Don't splurge on this; other perfumes are just as good and less expensive. Agree with those who think it's very similar to Rosa Nobile. It's good but nothing special, I enjoy it, but I don't miss it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="29083"comment_id="1549026"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/A-La-Rose-29083.html?ccid=1549026#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1546954" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1546954" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gidzbox"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1217742"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gidzbox" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Alien-707.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.707.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alien"title="Alien"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1546954ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1546954" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);
